p: Influenza virus: Influenza is a (-) sense ssRNA virus in the family Orthomyxoviridae. Its genome is segmented, which has important implications in virus evolution and immune escape (discussed below). There are four Classes of influenza; A, B, C and D, and additional genera [ 16]. However, most human outbreaks are caused by influenza type A virus (IAV). IAV has several subtypes which are based on the two main surface proteins hemagglutinin (H, HA) and neuraminidase (N, NA). There are currently 18 HA types (H1 to H18) and 11 NA types (N1 to N11) [ 16â€“ 18].
